summary:
Today, Gaza’s death toll topped at least 66,000, according to NPR, as Israeli forces intensified strikes on hospitals and high-rise buildings while Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu prepares to meet U.S. President Trump. The escalation has tightened access for humanitarian aid and provoked growing international calls for stronger civilian protections; observers warn that the coming diplomatic engagement could determine whether more aid corridors open or military operations continue unrestrained. Humanitarian groups and foreign governments are pressing for immediate increases in deliveries and clear rules of engagement; if substantial aid and safeguards are not secured before Netanyahu’s meeting with Trump, the risk of further large-scale civilian casualties and collapsing services in Gaza will rise in the days ahead.

Elsewhere, governance and non‑conflict developments stood out. Moldova’s pro‑EU PAS won more than 50 percent of the vote, France 24 reports, strengthening a push toward European integration while raising concerns about potential Russian interference and the need to form a stable government. Prosecutors allege long‑running sex‑trafficking abuses by leaders of La Luz del Mundo, a case that could reshape oversight of transnational faith groups. The UN says Iran uses drones and apps to enforce hijab rules, posing civil‑liberties risks. In science and markets, SpaceX and NASA launched a replacement crew to the ISS, and U.S. $100 million EXIM guarantee aims to spur investment in Africa’s digital sector. Residents were urged to seek shelter as Typhoon Bualoi made landfall in Vietnam.

headlines.title: Gaza death toll tops at least 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump
headlines.summary: The toll exceeds 66,000, underscoring urgent humanitarian needs in Gaza; calls grow for increased aid deliveries and civilian protections during diplomacy.

headlines.title: Israel bombs hospitals and towers as Gaza onslaught intensifies
headlines.summary: The Israeli military targets hospitals and high-rise buildings amid an intensified Gaza City assault; civilians face mounting danger, and aid access remains limited while observers call for restraint.

headlines.title: Leaders of La Luz del Mundo face sex-trafficking allegations, officials allege
headlines.summary: Prosecutors allege the church's leadership orchestrated abuse for decades, a case that could affect faith groups and transnational operations; next steps include legal proceedings and potential reforms.

headlines.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party wins pivotal election with more than 50% of the vote
headlines.summary: PAS gains a decisive victory signaling renewed push toward European integration; observers warn about potential Russian interference and the need for stable democratic governance in Moldova.

headlines.title: SpaceX and NASA launch crew to space station to retrieve stuck astronauts
headlines.summary: A replacement crew lifts off from Florida to the ISS, enabling the return of astronauts who have spent nine months aboard; rotation maintains station operations.

headlines.title: UN says Iran uses drones and apps to enforce hijab law
headlines.summary: The UN report details surveillance tools including drones, facial recognition, and the Nazer app to monitor and report violations; critics warn of civil liberties risks.

headlines.title: Deadly Typhoon Bualoi makes landfall in Vietnam
headlines.summary: After killing at least 11 in the Philippines, the storm hits Vietnam earlier than expected, bringing risks of flash floods and landslides; residents urged to seek shelter.

headlines.title: EU climate watchdog urges Europe to step up environmental protections
headlines.summary: Agency warns member states must intensify protections and adapt to warming amid internal divisions after climate talks failed to agree on 2035 targets.

headlines.title: U.S. and partners announce $100M EXIM guarantee for Africa's digital sector
headlines.summary: The EXIM-backed guarantee aims to unlock capital and de-risk market entry for American tech firms in Africa; next steps include project selection and due diligence.
